Eugene, feel free to assign to me if you want me to fix this.
Steffen, should encoder use encoding from the repository settings and not hardcoded utf-8 encoding?
I am not sure. I assumed that UTF-8 is always correct for URLs but JIRA might in fact use the repository encoding. I'll add a test case that has non-USASCII characters.

Turns out that it is not possible to upload patches through HttpCient that have non-USASCII characters. FilePart.sendDispositionHeader() invokes EncodingUtil.getAsciiBytes(filename) which will replace every non-USASCII character with a question mark which is rejected by JIRA. Interestingly it works if I upload through a web-browser (konqueror) which seems to use ISO-8859-1 to encode the filename.

I switched to using the repository encoding when getting attachments and added a FAQ entry for the uploading.
